function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Ineffective placement of PACs leading to uneven air purification and particle removal in the built environment.","Impact":"Uneven air quality and particle distribution, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Implement a systematic approach to determine the optimal placement of PACs based on airflow dynamics and occupancy patterns. Regularly assess and adjust the placement.","Technologies":"Airflow modeling software, occupancy sensors, dynamic air purifier adjustment systems.","People":"Building occupants, especially in shared spaces like gyms, classrooms, and dental rooms.","Owner":"Building managers, facility engineers, HVAC professionals."},{"Description":"Ineffective operation and maintenance of HEPA filtration systems leading to reduced efficiency in particle removal and air purification.","Impact":"Decreased filtration efficiency, allowing particles to circulate and accumulate in the indoor environment, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Establish a comprehensive maintenance protocol including regular filter replacement, airflow monitoring, and sealing inspections. Utilize advanced filtration monitoring systems.","Technologies":"Filtration monitoring sensors, automated filter replacement systems, airflow testing equipment.","People":"Building maintenance staff, HVAC technicians, facility managers.","Owner":"Facility operators, building owners, healthcare facility administrators."}]}
